p: LiNb 2(AlH 4) 7 was formed at −70 °C; meanwhile, LiNb 2(AlH 4) 5 and LiNb(AlH 4) 3 were formed at 25 °C [ 246]. Wiberg et al. wonderfully described the synthesis procedure and the changes in the color that are associated with each Nb or LiNb- alanates. However, a detailed characterization is needed, particularly the characterization of the material obtained at room temperature Nb 2(AlH 4) 5 (5.9 wt.% hydrogen content).
